work.p: The manuscript on the verso is possibly related to "O Tan Faced Prairie Boy," which was first published in Drum-Taps (1865).
The manuscript on the verso is possibly related to the poem first published as "Calamus" No. 25 in the 1860 edition of Leaves of Grass and eventually titled "The Prairie-Grass Dividing."
The manuscript on the verso is possibly related to "Pioneers! O Pioneers," which was first published in Drum-Taps (1865).
The manuscript on the verso is possibly related to "The Prairie States," which was first published in The Art Autograph, May 1880.

titleStmt.title: The States
a machine readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Walt Whitman

availability.p: The text of the original item is in the public domain. The text encoding and editorial notes were created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Any reuse of the material should credit the Walt Whitman Archive. Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

notesStmt.note: This manuscript was likely written between 1857 and 1860.

The manuscript contains a list of thirteen suggestions for titles or groups of poems, including "The States," "Prairies," "Prairie Spaces" and "Prairie Babes." "In Paths Untrodden" opens the "Calamus" group in all editions of Leaves of Grass, taking the title in 1867.
